keyboardNavigation.notes: Radix UI provides excellent keyboard support. Tab, Enter, Space work perfectly. Arrow keys, Home/End should be tested to verify Radix implementation.

screenReaderSupport.notes: Radix UI implements WAI-ARIA Tabs pattern perfectly. role=tablist, role=tab, role=tabpanel. aria-selected, aria-controls, aria-labelledby all properly managed.

visualAccessibility.notes: Token system provides good contrast. Focus indicators visible. framer-motion animation needs prefers-reduced-motion verification. AAA contrast (7:1) needs verification for all variants.

ariaCompliance.notes: Perfect ARIA implementation via Radix UI. Follows WAI-ARIA Tabs design pattern exactly. All roles, states, and properties correctly applied.

strengths: Built on Radix UI providing robust ARIA tab pattern implementation
Proper semantic HTML with tab roles (tablist, tab, tabpanel)
Excellent keyboard navigation with Tab and Enter/Space support
Focus management with visible focus indicators
Full support for closable tabs with proper event handling
Disabled state correctly implemented with aria-disabled
Scrollable tab overflow with smooth behavior
Support for left/right slots with icons

issuesFound.description: Arrow key navigation not explicitly verified
issuesFound.impact: Power users may expect arrow keys to navigate between tabs (WAI-ARIA Tabs pattern recommendation)
issuesFound.suggestion: Verify if Radix UI provides arrow key navigation. Test with Left/Right arrows, Home/End keys. Document behavior in accessibility docs.

issuesFound.description: Enhanced contrast (7:1) not verified for all tab variants
issuesFound.impact: Users with low vision may have difficulty reading tab labels in some variants
issuesFound.suggestion: Verify UNDERLINE, OVERLAY, and FILLED variants meet 7:1 contrast ratio for AAA compliance. Document specific ratios for each variant and state (default, hover, active, disabled).

issuesFound.description: Touch target size not verified for 44×44px AAA requirement
issuesFound.impact: Users with motor disabilities may have difficulty with smaller tabs, especially SM size
issuesFound.suggestion: Verify all tab sizes (SM, MD, LG) meet minimum 44×44px for AAA. Measure actual rendered dimensions with padding. Small size may need padding adjustments.

recommendations: Explicitly test and document arrow key navigation behavior (Left/Right/Home/End)
Verify and document color contrast ratios for all tab variants to confirm AAA compliance (7:1)
Measure actual rendered touch target sizes for all tab sizes
Verify framer-motion respects prefers-reduced-motion user preference
Add aria-label='Close tab' to close button for better screen reader announcement
Document accessible tab patterns in storybook (with icons, closable, overflow)
Test with Windows High Contrast Mode and document results
Add visual regression tests for focus indicators across all variants
Consider adding optional keyboard shortcuts documentation for power users
Test horizontal scrolling with keyboard navigation (arrow keys on scroll container)
